CONJUGATES: minimally (adv) | minimum (n) | more minimal (comp) | most minimal (superl)
ETYMOLOGY: From Latin minimus ('smallest, least'), via minimum, combined with the adjectival suffix -al.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: constituting the minimum required or acceptable; the smallest amount or degree possible.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 最小的；最低限度的；微不足道的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The damage to the building was fortunately minimal, requiring only minor repairs.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 幸好对建筑物的损坏很小，只需要进行小修。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: characterized by simplicity and a deliberate lack of excessive decoration or complexity; pertaining to minimalism.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 极简主义的；简约的；朴素的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The artist adopted a minimal style, using only black and white lines.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位艺术家采用了极简风格，仅使用黑白线条。
